schema.name: mAdminState
schema.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
schema.label: Enable administrative state
schema.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
schema.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
A descriptive summary for the settings
schema.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the settings.
schema.name: UserSummary
DocumentType

value.name: detect
value.description: Detects the document type and parses the payload accordingly.

value.name: binary
value.description: Parse the payload as binary large object (BLOB).

value.name: graphql
value.description: <p>Parse the payload as GraphQL.</p><p>Query variables can be sent as a JSON string in a query parameter called <tt>variables</tt> . If the query contains several named operations, an <tt>operationName</tt> query parameter is required to determine which operation is to be executed.</p>

schema.description: Specifies the type of document to parse. By default, the document type is automatically detected.

schema.name: DocumentSize
schema.summary: Maximum document size that the parse action accepts
schema.description: Specifies the maximum document size in bytes that the parse action accepts. This setting provides threat protection by enforcing the maximum document size. Enter a value in the range 0 - 5368709121. The default value is 4194304. A document is rejected when its size exceeds the maximum size. A value of 0 indicates an unlimited document size. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the document size. This setting is applicable to binary, JSON, XML, or GraphQL input documents.

schema.name: NestingDepth
schema.summary: Maximum nesting depth of the XML, JSON, or GraphQL message that the parse action accepts
schema.description: <p>Specifies the maximum level of nested element depth in an XML, JSON, or GraphQL message that the parse action accepts. This setting provides threat protection by enforcing limits in the message. <ul><li>For XML, it is the maximum level of element depth.</li><li>For JSON, it is the maximum number of nested label-value pairs, the maximum number of nested arrays, or the maximum number of combination of label-value pairs and arrays.</li><li>For GraphQL, the nesting depth specifies the maximum level of nested selection sets.</li></ul></p><p>Enter a value in the range 0 - 4096. The default value is 512. A document is rejected when its nesting depth exceeds the maximum depth. A value of 0 indicates unlimited nesting depth. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the nesting depth of a document.</p>

schema.name: Width
schema.summary: Maximum width of a payload that the parse action accepts
schema.description: <p>Specifies the maximum width of a payload that the parse action accepts. This constraint is relevant only when the input document is XML, JSON, or GraphQL. <ul><li>When the input document is XML, this property specifies: <ul><li>The maximum number of attributes on an element</li><li>The maximum number of child elements for an element</li></ul></li><li>When the input document is JSON, this property specifies: <ul><li>The maximum number of properties on a JSON object</li><li>The maximum number of JSON items in a JSON array</li></ul></li><li>When the input document is GraphQL, this property specifies the maximum number of selections in a selection set.</li></ul></p><p>Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 4096. The document is rejected when its width exceeds the maximum width. A value of 0 indicates unlimited width. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the width of the document.</p>

schema.name: NameLength
schema.summary: Maximum name length that the parse action accepts
schema.description: <p>Specifies the maximum name length in bytes that the parse action accepts. This constraint is relevant only when the input document is XML, JSON, or GraphQL. <ul><li>For XML, it is the length of the name portion of a tag.</li><li>For JSON, it is the length of the label portion of the JSON label-value pair.</li><li>For GraphQL, it is the length of the identifiers, including field names and directive names.</li></ul></p><p>The length includes any white space that is contained between tags in XML or quotation marks in JSON. Enter a value in the range 0 - 8192. The default value is 256. A document is rejected when its name length exceeds the maximum length. A value of 0 indicates unlimited name length. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the name length of a document.</p>

schema.name: ValueLength
schema.summary: Maximum value length that the parse action accepts
schema.description: <p>Specify the maximum value length in bytes that the parse action accepts. This constraint is relevant only when the input document is XML, JSON, or GraphQL. <ul><li>For XML, it is the length of an attribute or the length of a text value.</li><li>For JSON, it is the length of a string value.</li><li>For GraphQL, it is the number of bytes in any string from which GraphQL is composed.</li></ul></p><p>The length includes any white space that is contained between tags in XML or quotation marks in JSON. Enter a value in the range 0 - 5368709121. The default value is 8192. A document is rejected when its value length exceeds the maximum length. A value of 0 indicates unlimited value length. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the value length of a document.</p>

schema.name: UniquePrefixes
schema.summary: Maximum number of unique prefixes that the parse action accepts
schema.description: Specifies the maximum number of unique XML namespace prefixes in a document that the parse action accepts. This limit counts multiple prefixes defined for the same namespace, but does not count multiple namespaces defined in different parts of the input document under a single prefix. Enter a value in the range 0 - 262143. The default value is 1024. A document is rejected when the number of unique prefixes in the document exceeds the maximum number. A value of 0 indicates an unlimited number of unique prefixes. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the number of unique prefixes in a document.

schema.name: UniqueNamespaces
schema.summary: Maximum number of unique namespaces that the parse action accepts
schema.description: Specifies the maximum number of unique XML namespace URIs that the parse action accepts. This limit counts all XML namespaces, regardless of how many prefixes are used to declare them. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 1024. A document is rejected when the number of unique namespaces in the document exceeds the maximum number. A value of 0 indicates an unlimited number of unique namespaces. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the number of unique namespaces in a document.

schema.name: UniqueNames
schema.summary: Maximum number of unique names that the parse action accepts
schema.description: <p>Specify the maximum number of unique names that the parse action accepts. <ul><li>For XML, it is the number of unique XML local names.</li><li>For JSON, it is the number of unique JSON labels.</li></ul></p><p>Enter a value in the range 0 - 1048575. The default value is 1024. A document is rejected when the number of unique names in the document exceeds the maximum number. A value of 0 indicates an unlimited number of unique names. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the number of unique names in a document.</p>

schema.name: NumberLength
schema.summary: Maximum number length that the parse action accepts
schema.description: The maximum number length limits the number of bytes in the value portion of a label-value pair when the value is a number. The number must be a contiguous string of bytes that contain no white space. The number can include a minus sign and a positive or negative exponent. Enter a value in the range 0 - 256. The default value is 128. A document is rejected when the number length in the document exceeds the maximum length. A value of 0 indicates unlimited number length. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the number length in a document.
